SENT.plain: We report the case of a 24 year-old pregnant woman, seen at the neurology service by presenting agitation, hallucinations, mental confusion, headache, vision loss, aphasia and seizures
The neuroradiologic exam was compatible with thrombosis in dural sinus and cortical veins
Treatment with abciximab was accomplished and the mechanical lysis of the thrombus was made obtaining restoration of cerebral vein flow
After the procedure, she presented frontal hematoma which was withdrawn surgically
We discuss this infrequent pathology in clinical picture, pathogenesis, image exams and therapeutics
